intro: Digitaria sanguinalis var. interrupta, commonly known as red sandreed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its reddish stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as fields and roadsides. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. This species is adaptable and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
